return.p: Returns true if the value is not a number, otherwise false.

example.heading: isFinite example
example.code:
console.log(isFinite(NaN)); // false console.log(isFinite("string")); // false console.log(isFinite("12")); // true console.log(isFinite(12)); // true console.log(isFinite(12.42)); // true
console.log(isFinite("")); // true console.log(isFinite("\n\t")); // true console.log(isFinite(null)); // true console.log(isFinite(true)); // true
console.log(isFinite(undefined)); // false
console.log(isFinite(Infinity)); // false
